item.title: The significance of the new Space Force military doctrine cannot...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The significance of the new Space Force military doctrine cannot be overstated. Whether Trump or Biden wins, the Space Force doctrine will be operational. And Democrats have shown they will wield all aspects of the military industrial complex just as effectively and ruthlessly as Republicans.

In preparation for “major power” conflict in coming years, the Pentagon and U.S. government are prioritizing advancing technologies and capabilities to dominate and control space, with the belief that conquering the “ultimate high ground” of space will allow them to win... #antimilitarism #a...

liberationnews.org

First-ever U.S. Space Force doctrine calls for space supremacy...

In preparation for “major power” conflict in coming years, the Pentagon and U.S. government are prioritizing advancing technologies and capabilities to dominate and control space, with the belief that conquering the “ultimate high ground” of space will allow them to win... #antimilitarism #a...In preparation for “major power” conflict in coming years, the Pentagon and U.S. government are prioritizing advancing technologies and capabilities to dominate and control space, with the belief that conquering the “ultimate high ground” of space will allow them to win... #antimilitarism #a...

item.title: We could be headed to the most volatile election in U.S....
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

We could be headed to the most volatile election in U.S. history, with both candidates refusing to concede. Could this lead to violence on the street? Monica Cruz of BreakThrough analyzes the potential for an historic ruling class crisis.

BreakThrough News

On Election Night 2020, the map could show Trump with an overwhelming victory, only to be reversed by the counting of mail-in ballots. We could be headed to the... most volatile election in U.S. history, with both candidates refusing to concede. Could this lead to violence on the street? Monica Cruz of BreakThrough analyzes the potential for an historic ruling class crisis.

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for election resources and official updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Yesterday some 1500 community members marched on foot and in...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Yesterday some 1500 community members marched on foot and in their cars down Colfax from Aurora to Denver against racism and police violence. People all along the march came out of their homes and shops and stopped on the streets to watch and show their support. Families from across the state who have had their loved ones murdered by the police came to speak and march with us.

People all over this country are tired of the racism and the brutality of life under this system. They are ready for change! The future lies in the hands of the people! Together we will one day crush this racist system and build one that works for all of us!

Keep building, keep fighting! All power to the people!

+46
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: In a capitalist society, we can see the contradiction of...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

In a capitalist society, we can see the contradiction of corporations calling workers “essential” and then by either lack of preparation or unwillingness fail to provide essential protections.

Even as fires in California cause unhealthy air quality all over the state, farmworkers are still working hard. #agriculture #california #environment

liberationnews.org

Farm workers’ lives on the line as California burns

Even as fires in California cause unhealthy air quality all over the state, farmworkers are still working hard. #agriculture #california #environmentEven as fires in California cause unhealthy air quality all over the state, farmworkers are still working hard. #agriculture #california #environment

item.title: Today we honor Fred Hampton on what would have been his 72nd...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Today we honor Fred Hampton on what would have been his 72nd birthday.

Fred Hampton was a young revolutionary socialist and chairman of the Black Panther Party in Chicago.

Hampton was a community-builder. He brokered a nonaggression pact between Chicago’s most powerful street gangs, urging them to turn their anger and guns around on their oppressors, not on one another.

...Continue Reading

item.title: Revolutionary women of the PSL on the frontlines of the struggle...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Revolutionary women of the PSL on the frontlines of the struggle ✊🚩

Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

In celebration of the 10th issue of Breaking the Chains magazine, we want to showcase the amazing women who not only create this magazine but also put theory in...to practice by organizing in the streets! From Los Angeles to Boston, women are on the frontlines of the rebellion against racism and police violence. As unemployment and COVID-19 cases continue to rise, women have shown that they are not only essential workers but are essential to revolution! We will continue to mobilize in the streets and build towards a feminist and socialist future, because the struggle for women's liberation is part and parcel of the liberation of ALL workers!

Get the latest copy of Breaking the Chains magazine, "From Capitalist Cages to Socialist Liberation", at pslweb.org/store

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Check out the Denver Police Department putting on an ice cream...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Check out the Denver Police Department putting on an ice cream social to draw parents and kids out to meet "Officer Friendly". It's more important than ever to the police to do PR with the parts of the community disconnected enough from their brutality to believe they're really here to "protect and serve".

The truth is that DPD is not family-friendly. They are not sweet or cuddly. Denver police murdered William Debose, Paul Childs, Dion Damon, Michael Marshall, Jason Gomez, J...esse Hernandez, Marvin Booker, Paul Castaway, Ryan Ronquillo, Joseph Valverde, Odiceo Valencia-Lopez, Naeschylus Carter-Vinzant, and many more. They have brutalized countless members of our community and put many more behind bars. They have spent the summer brutally repressing the anti-racist protest movement.

These PR stunts are repulsive, but they will not be enough to stop the advance of consciousness around the true nature of the police.

See More

item.title: The plight of people behind bars in the U.S. during the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The plight of people behind bars in the U.S. during the coronavirus pandemic is dire. Prisoners and detainees are getting sick and dying at highly elevated rates, and without immediate and sweeping action, mass deaths—disproportionately of poor, Black, Brown, and Indigenous people—are a certainty. This is why PSL Denver is backing tomorrow’s Decarceration Day of Action, organized by the Colorado ACLU and endorsed by more than 50 local organizations.

Join the rally at noon tomorrow at the capitol, and demand Governor Polis immediately release all elderly, vulnerable, non-dangerous, and non-convicted inmates and all ICE detainees!
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: The plight of people behind bars in the U.S. during the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The plight of people behind bars in the U.S. during the coronavirus pandemic is dire. Prisoners and detainees are getting sick and dying at highly elevated rates, and without immediate and sweeping action, mass deaths—disproportionately of poor, Black, Brown, and Indigenous people—are a certainty. This is why PSL Denver is backing tomorrow’s Decarceration Day of Action. Join the rally at noon tomorrow at the capitol and read Dr. Apryl Alexander’s opinion piece on the day of a...ction in the Denver Post.

“After briefly allowing increased prisoner releases, the governor has rescinded that authority and refuses to exercise any of his broad powers to safely reduce the prison population.

Surely, the governor is aware that the United States incarcerates people at a higher rate than any other country in the world, and that mass incarceration has destroyed Black communities, without improving public safety. Surely he is aware that our carceral system is founded on racist principles, and the racial make-up of our prisons is a reflection of historical and ongoing systemic racism.

Yet, rather than acknowledging the humanity of people living behind bars and the racism underlying the prison system, Gov. Polis has contributed to a public narrative that demonizes incarcerated people as unredeemable and too dangerous to be free. When advocates called for thoughtful releases of vulnerable incarcerated people, Gov. Polis’ response: He would not “let dangerous criminals out.”

Come on, governor. No one wants you to release “dangerous criminals.” We all want to be safe. That’s why advocates have been calling for the release of people who are elderly, sick, or have otherwise proven they are not a public safety threat. Decades of mass incarceration has ensured that there are many such people in Colorado’s prisons, and racism has ensured that those people will be disproportionately Black.

Here’s just one example: Ron Johnson is a 62-year-old Black grandfather who has turned his life around in prison. He suffers from asthma, high blood pressure, and uses an inhaler to breathe, so he is at high risk for COVID. He is no threat to the public. He lives in an incentive unit where he cares for other incarcerated people with medical disabilities and mentors incarcerated people earning their GED.”

See MoreBlack people living behind bars face a racist double whammy – because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.

denverpost.com

Guest commentary: If Black lives matter to him, Polis needs to reduce prison population

Black people living behind bars face a racist double whammy – because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.Black people living behind bars face a racist double whammy – because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.
